## Plot ggplot()

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

```{r}
setwd("/Users/cmdb/qb25-answers/week1")
library(tidyverse)

header <- c( "chr", "start", "end", "count" )
df_kc <- read_tsv("/Users/cmdb/qb25-answers/week1/hg19-kc-count.bed", col_names=header)
df_kc2 <- read_tsv("/Users/cmdb/qb25-answers/week1/hg16-kc-count.bed", col_names=header)
df_combined <- bind_rows(hg19=df_kc, hg16=df_kc2, .id="assembly" )

ggplot(data = df_combined, aes(x = start, y = count, color = assembly)) + 
  geom_line() + 
  facet_wrap("chr", scales = "free") +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("midnightblue" , "pink1"))
ggsave("exercise2.png", width = 10, height = 6)
```
